document.docAuthor: Volynkin, Anton V., Černý, Karel & Huang, Si-Yao
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Barsine hypoprepioides (Walker, 1862) species-group, with descriptions of fifteen new species and a new subspecies (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Barsine hypoprepioides (Walker, 1862) species-group, with descriptions of fifteen new species and a new subspecies (Lepidoptera, Erebidae, Arctiinae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Lithosia hypoprepioides Walker, 1862
, Journal of the proceedings of the Linnean Society. Zoology , 6 : 106 ( Type locality: [ Malaysia , Borneo] “ Sarawak ”).

Remarks. 1. In the original description, Walker (1862) did not mention a number of specimens, therefore the existence of syntypes is probable. To avoid any confusion, here we designate the female type specimen deposited in the OUMNH collection as lectotype . 2. Holloway (2001) and Volynkin (2018) erroneously illustrated the female genitalia of an undetermined
Miltochrista
species as those of
B. hypoprepioides
.

Diagnosis . Forewing length is 10–11 mm in males and 12.5–14 mm in females.
Barsine hypoprepioides
is similar externally to
B. dubatolovi
sp. n.
,
B. syntypicoida
sp. n.
and
B. syntypica
, but differ by its slightly more yellowish wing coloration, antemedial and medial lines not interrupted and the presence of a medial transverse line on hindwing. The male genitalia of
B. hypoprepioides
resemble those of
B. dubatolovi
sp. n.
, but differ by their vinculum being tapered apically (that is pointed apically in
B. dubatolovi
sp. n.
), smaller medial costal process, much larger, claw-like distal costal process, more robust distal saccular process being stronger curved dorsally, aedeagus being broader distally, and much smaller vesica. The female genitalia of
B. hypoprepioides
differ from those of
B. dubatolovi
sp. n.
by the much longer antrum having large postero-lateral lobes, smaller corpus bursae and much shorter, membranous appendix bursae (that is longer and armed with spinulose scobination in
B. dubatolovi
sp. n.
).
Distribution . Malaysia (Borneo Isl.) ( Holloway 2001 ) and Indonesia ( Sumatra Isl.).
